title: Saguaro National Park: Curve-billed Thrasher
body: Curve-billed Thrasher         Curve-billed Thrasher NPS photo  Curve-billed Thrasher (Toxostoma curvirostre) The curve-billed thrasher is a large, grayish-brown bird with yellow eyes and a noticeably curved bill. A ground forager, the curve-billed thrasher uses its bill to flick aside and dig in the soil for insects and seeds. It builds a nest of twigs in cholla cactus, yucca, or mesquite and has been known to destroy cactus wren nests when nesting sites are in demand. Length: 11 in. Wingspan: 13.5 in. Diet: Insects, berries, and fruit
